title: High Arable Land Per Capita
description: In 2021, Kazakhstan had 1.5027 hectares of arable land per person, one of the highest in the world, indicating significant agricultural potential.

title: Minimal Urban Slum Population
description: As of 2020, only 0.79% of Kazakhstan's urban population lived in slums, showcasing effective urban planning and housing policies.

title: High Export Tax Revenue
description: In 2023, Kazakhstan collected 2,135,352,265,935.25 LCU in taxes on exports, reflecting a strong export sector.

title: Full Male Primary Education Completion
description: In 2019, 100% of male students in Kazakhstan persisted to the last grade of primary education, highlighting a robust educational system.

title: High Female Post-Secondary Education
description: By 2018, 79.04% of women aged 25+ had completed post-secondary education, indicating strong female educational attainment.

title: High Male Post-Secondary Education
description: In 2018, 78.99% of men aged 25+ had completed post-secondary education, reflecting a well-educated male population.

title: Near-Universal Secondary School Enrollment
description: Kazakhstan achieved a 99.84% net enrollment rate in secondary education in 2019, demonstrating widespread access to education.

title: High Short-Cycle Tertiary Education Completion
description: By 2018, 73.91% of the population aged 25+ had completed short-cycle tertiary education, showcasing a highly educated workforce.

title: Extensive Rural Handwashing Facilities
description: In 2019, 98.73% of Kazakhstan's rural population had access to basic handwashing facilities, promoting public health.

title: Low Poverty Rate
description: As of 2021, only 3.1% of Kazakhstan's population lived below 50% of the median income, indicating low poverty levels.

title: High Female Employment Rate
description: In 2022, 94.5% of women aged 15+ were employed, reflecting strong female participation in the workforce.

title: High Male Employment Rate
description: In 2022, 95.7% of men aged 15+ were employed, indicating a robust male workforce.

title: Low Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, only 0.6% of Kazakhstan's population experienced severe food insecurity, highlighting effective food security measures.

title: Low Government Expenditure on Primary Education
description: In 2018, government expenditure per student in primary education was only 0.235% of GDP per capita, suggesting potential underfunding.

title: Low Expenditure on Primary Education
description: In 2018, only 0.657% of government expenditure was allocated to primary education, indicating a need for increased investment.
